Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                               About ITS                              Get Connected                               Communicate & Collaborate                               Help & Support                                 Computer Security                               Instruction & Research                                Locations & Facilities                              Advanced Media Studio                                 Assistive Technologies                          Computer Labs                           Data Services                             Digital Studio                          NYU Global Sites                        Hands-on Computer Classrooms                          IT Service Desk                          Map of ITS Locations                        NYU Print Service                                                                                     Home           //        Locations & Facilities                 //         Advanced Media Studio                                            Advanced Media Studio                                                              search the site                                                                                 Advanced Media Studio      35 West 4th Street      Second Floor            Contact Information:       ams@nyu.edu      212-998-3454      212-998-3425      Doctor's Hours      To schedule a one-on-one consultation with the AMS staff, see the Schedule page.                AMS Reservations    The AMS Self-Service Workstations are approved-access and reservation-required stations offering special discipline hardware and software, featuring:     Flextight Virtual Drum Film Scanners     Epson Stylus Pro 4880 archival printers using Epson Ultrachrome K3™ ink technology    3D software workstations, featuring:   Autodesk Maya   Rhinoceros 3D (Rhino) for PC   Cinema 4D   MeshLab   Blender   Pixologic ZBrush    netfab Studio   SolidWorks for PC    Z Corporation ZPrint for PC   Geomagic Studio   TopoGun    Advanced imaging workstations, featuring:   Adobe Creative Suite Software   Adobe Lightroom   ColorBurst RIP   Flextight Scanning Software      AMS Reservation Calendar Terms of Use   You are required to use your NYU E-mail account when reserving a workstation, insuring that your NYU NetID is recorded. You may reserve up to six hours at a workstation at a time. Slots reserved beyond the six-hour maximum will be removed by AMS staff. If you are more than 15 minutes late for your reservation, your reservation will be canceled and made available to other clients. The AMS reserves the right to cancel reservations as needed for the purpose of hardware and software troubleshooting, or for severe weather events requiring facility closing.     How to Reserve a Workstation   In a separate browser tab or window, log into your NYU Email account powered by Google, to expedite the connection to the AMS Google Reservation Calendar. ( Note: Do not use a personal Gmail account as it may not properly sync with NYU's Google Calendar system.) Select the link of the self-service workstation you would like to reserve from the list below. In the reservation calendar that opens, you will see the time slots that are available for reservation. Reservation slots are configured in 30-minute sections. Select the desired 30-minute slot(s) to complete your reservation for that station (up to six hours). A confirmation window will appear. Once you have confirmed the time and the workstation, click Save .   Reservations for the 3D D PC Mojo Print workstation are configured as single day slots. Clients can expect to complete a 2"x 2"x 2" model build within a 24-hour period. Larger models (up to the 5"x 5"x 5" maximum) will require two slots, or up to 48 hours, to complete printing.     3D A Mac/PC    3D B Mac    3D C Mac    3D D PC Mojo Print    Mac Print 4900 A    Mac Print 4900 B    Mac Print 4900 C    Mac Print 4900 D    Flextight A    Flextight B      Please note: The AMS Reservation Calendar hours are subject to adjustment on a semester-by-semester basis.       Page last reviewed: October 22, 2014

Friday, March 20: Open 10am - 5pm ET   Monday, March 23 ET: Normal hours resume         General Information     The Advanced Media Studio (AMS) is a state-of-the-art facility and technology resource for the NYU community. The AMS provides professional services in museum-grade wide-format archival digital printmaking, laser cutting and etching, rapid prototyping/3D printing, 3D scanning and project development consultation. The AMS features a suite of self-service workstations offering special discipline hardware and software, supporting content building for the AMS professional services.    Access to the Advanced Media Studio is granted to the entire NYU community. To request a consultation, or to schedule a visit, please see the contact information to the right. All AMS Services are offered at an internal charge rate for those within or affiliated with the NYU community. Please refer to the AMS Price List for price examples and payment terms.    Page last reviewed: March 11, 2015

NYU | Campus Media - Home                                                                                     Home     |    About     |    Contact Us    |    Site Map                                   Search buildings and rooms                                                                                         Reserve Equipment                  Order Form      Search      Policies                        Schedule Events                   Order Form      Rates      Policies                        Order Forms            Help                   FAQs       Glossary       Helpful Links       Troubleshooting       Tutorials                                  Welcome to Campus Media!    Take a look at Campus Media's FALL 2014 Newsletter!!             Campus Media offers a broad inventory of audio and video systems, projection equipment, laptop computers (PC and Macintosh), accessories for classroom support and special events, as well as demonstrations and training on the proper use of equipment.          Campus Media is comprised of two different areas:           Classroom Media  Services      Classroom Media Services provides equipment and support for official NYU     classes that meet in general purpose NYU classrooms. To learn more, click on     Reserve Equipment to search for rooms, reserve the equipment you need in your     class, learn more about the equipment in the classroom and find out more about     our loan policies.           Events Media  Services Events Media Services department supports all non-classroom special events in a variety of venues around the University. To learn more, click on Schedule Events to book equipment you need in your event, learn more about the equipment available, find out the rates charged and find out more about our policies.
